data.title: Robert Morris University Athletics
data.meta_description:
Freddie Harris (4) Center  - 
 Signed a National Letter of Intent with Robert Morris in June of 2005 ... Received a medical redshirt in 2006 after a foot injury
data.text:
Signed a National Letter of Intent with Robert Morris in June of 2005 ... Received a medical redshirt in 2006 after a foot injury ended his 2005-06 season after only five games ... Smart basketball player with court savvy and strong basketball knowledge ... Strong build allows him to battle for tough rebounds on the inside ... Accomplished shot blocker ... Good moves in the post allows him to convert easy baskets ... Will be counted on to provide Robert Morris with a veteran presence on the inside.

2006-07 Highlights (Senior): Started all 28 games at center ... Averaged 4.3 points and 3.0 rebounds per game while shooting 54.4 percent (49-for-90) from the field ... Averaged 16.4 minutes per game ... Shot 68.8 percent (22-for-32) from the free-throw line ... Contributed 23 assists, seven blocks and 10 steals ... Scored in double figures in three games ... Averaged 4.4 points and 3.5 rebounds per contest against Northeast Conference competition ... In home games shot 64.9 percent (37-for-57) from the field and 73.7 percent (14-for-19) from the free-throw line.

2005-06 Highlights (Junior): Appeared in just five games, all starting assignments, before suffering a season-ending foot injury ... Averaged 6.2 points and 3.2 rebounds per game while averaging 16.2 minutes per contest ... Shot 54.5 percent (12-for-22) from the field and 70 percent (7-for-10) from the free-throw line ... In Robert Morris debut scored 10 points and grabbed two rebounds in season-opener @ St. Bonaventure (11/18/05) in 20 minutes of action ... Scored six points and grabbed six rebounds in a 100-64 victory over Lock Haven (11/26/05) ... Shot 4-for-6 from the field and 3-for-3 from the free-throw line for 11 points in first half @ Duquesne (12/3/05) before suffering foot injury.

Community College and Personal: Coached by John Douglass at Lawson State Community College ... Over his two years at Lawson State averaged 6.8 points and 4.0 rebounds while shooting 57.6 percent from the field ... Averaged 6.9 points and 3.5 rebounds during the 2003-04 campaign in 22 games while shooting 62.6 percent (67-for-107) from the field ... Of his 76 rebounds on the year, 23 came on the offensive glass ... Also during the 2003-04 campaign finished with 22 assists, 12 steals and 11 blocks ... On the 2004-05 season averaged 6.7 points and 4.4 rebounds in 27 games ... Also shot 54.1 percent (80-for-148) from the field ... Finished with 37 assists, 18 steals and a team-high 37 blocks on the season ... Lawson State finished with a record of 49-15 over the two years Harris was a part of the squad ... Coached by Jamie Lee at Decatur High School ... Averaged 15.0 points and 8.0 rebounds during his senior season in 2002-03, garnering the club's best rebounder award ... Red Raiders finished with a 27-8 overall record in 2002-03 ... Has one sister, Shaundora ... Son of Freddie and Carol Harris ... Born July 31, 1985 ... Major is management.

Harris' Career Highs

Points - 16 vs. Youngstown State (12/16/06)

Field Goals - 5 on two occasions

Three-Point Field Goals - 0

Free Throws - 6 vs. Youngstown State (12/16/06)

Rebounds - 8 @ Long Island (1/11/07)

Assists - 2 on seven occasions

Blocks - 3 vs. Saint Francis (Pa.) (2/3/07)

Steals - 2 on two occasions

Minutes - 37 vs. St. Francis (N.Y.) (2/17/07)
